headline: It was a lie
description: A multi-panel illustrated piece combining handwritten text and symbolic imagery. Across several pages, fragmented phrases and drawings form a single, unified expression of betrayal, mistrust, and the stripping away of illusions. The work sits firmly in the Pale Moon Full phase, carrying mournful clarity and emotional precision.

resonantThread: Examining betrayal with unflinching honesty, revealing both the emotional wound and the clarity that follows.
whyItMatters: Encapsulates the act of naming harm plainly while preserving a reflective tone, offering both personal catharsis and a broader lens on trust.

motifMap.meaning: Visual emphasis on the central harm

articleExcerpt: "She only wanted my name and to break my spirit"
sourceFragments: Multi-panel notebook illustrations with handwritten annotations; original work by the author.
